questions.text: A patient with HIV who is currently on antiretroviral therapy consisting of zidovudine, lamivudine, and nevirapine is diagnosed with tuberculosis. Considering potential drug interactions, which of the following TB drugs should be changed in this patient? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Rifampicin

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ For HIV and TB cotreatment:
  • ➤ If a person is on the TLE regimen (tenofovir, lamivudine, efavirenz), it does not interact with rifampicin. The regimen can continue unchanged even if rifampicin is given. If the person is on the TLD regimen (tenofovir, lamivudine, dolutegravir), the dose of dolutegravir should be doubled when rifampicin is used, while the rest of the regimen remains the same. If the person is taking a protease inhibitor or nevirapine , rifampicin should be avoided. Instead, rifampicin should be replaced with rifabutin.
  • ➤ If a person is on the TLE regimen (tenofovir, lamivudine, efavirenz), it does not interact with rifampicin. The regimen can continue unchanged even if rifampicin is given.
  • ➤ TLE regimen
  • ➤ If the person is on the TLD regimen (tenofovir, lamivudine, dolutegravir), the dose of dolutegravir should be doubled when rifampicin is used, while the rest of the regimen remains the same.
  • ➤ TLD regimen
  • ➤ If the person is taking a protease inhibitor or nevirapine , rifampicin should be avoided. Instead, rifampicin should be replaced with rifabutin.
  • ➤ protease inhibitor
  • ➤ nevirapine

questions.text: An intra-operative image of scrotal exploration is shown. Identify the pathology. (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans.  A) Testicular torsion

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Testicular torsion presents as acute testicular pain and requires urgent surgical intervention. The characteristic appearance on exploration includes a discolored, possibly non-viable testis due to the loss of blood supply.

questions.text: Which of these statements is true for Adipocere change after death? (NEET PG 2024)

options.label: D
options.text: Occurs due to saponification of fats

questions.correct_answer: D. Occurs due to saponification of fats
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Occurs due to saponification of fats

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Adipocere formation after death occurs due to the saponification of fats through an enzymatic process, primarily under warm, moist, and anaerobic conditions.

questions.text: A hypertensive patient presents with an irregularly irregular pulse and a loud P2 on auscultation. Upon examination of the Jugular Venous Pressure (JVP), which finding is most likely to be observed in this patient? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Absent a wave

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In atrial fibrillation, the key JVP finding is the absence of the a wave due to the lack of effective atrial contraction. This is one of the classic "four no's" associated with atrial fibrillation: no a wave in the JVP, no P wave on ECG, no pre-systolic accentuation in mitral stenosis, and no S4 heart sound.

questions.text: A 45-year-old female, who had visited multiple plastic surgeons requesting correction of "face deformity," was referred to a Psychiatrist. The patient insists that her face is deformed and needs surgery despite no evidence of deformity in the examination. The patient persists with her demand despite family members’ and doctors' reassurances. What is the management? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) SSRI

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In Body Dysmorphic Disorder (BDD), especially when insight is poor or absent, SSRIs are the drug of choice for management, often in combination with Cognitive Behavioral Therapy (CBT). Surgery is contraindicated as it does not address the core psychological issue.

questions.text: A male patient with a history of unprotected sexual intercourse four days back came with complaints of painful urethral discharge. What is the treatment of choice? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Cefixime 400 mg stat

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The first-line treatment for gonococcal urethritis is a single dose of Cefixime 400 mg stat . This treatment is effective against Neisseria gonorrhoeae, the bacteria responsible for the infection.
  • ➤ Cefixime 400 mg stat

questions.text: A 40-year-old woman presents with heavy menstrual bleeding and something coming out of the vagina. Her last childbirth was 10 years back. On bimanual palpation, the uterus is palpable. On examination, the cervix admits 1 finger, and the following is seen. What is the probable diagnosis? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Fibroid polyp

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ A fibroid polyp presents with heavy menstrual bleeding, a palpable uterus on bimanual examination, and a protruding mass in the vagina due to the fibroid extending through the cervix

questions.text: What does ‘H’ indicate in a patient presenting with a history of EHEC O157:H7? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Flagella

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In bacterial antigen classification, the ‘H’ antigen corresponds to flagella, which are essential for motility.

questions.text: In a prolonged intubation patient, the following is seen. Staging for this is given by: (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Cotton Meyer

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Subglottic stenosis resulting from prolonged intubation is staged using the Cotton Meyer classification, which grades the severity based on the percentage of airway narrowing
  • ➤ Grade 1: 0-50% stenosis Grade 2: 51-70% stenosis Grade 3: 71-99% stenosis Grade 4: 100% stenosis (complete obstruction)
  • ➤ Grade 1: 0-50% stenosis
  • ➤ Grade 1:
  • ➤ Grade 2: 51-70% stenosis
  • ➤ Grade 2:
  • ➤ Grade 3: 71-99% stenosis
  • ➤ Grade 3:
  • ➤ Grade 4: 100% stenosis (complete obstruction)
  • ➤ Grade 4:

questions.text: An infant of 3 months presents with recurrent severe infections, including pneumonia, chronic diarrhea, and oral candidiasis. He has an absence of thymic shadow on chest X-ray. Laboratory tests reveal very low levels of adenosine deaminase (ADA). Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Severe combined immunodeficiency (SCID)

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ SCID is characterized by recurrent severe infections, absence of thymic shadow, and very low levels of adenosine deaminase, highlighting defects in both T and B cell function.

questions.text: A 57-year-old person completed his treatment of leprosy. Two years later, he presents with a punched-out painless ulcer on his sole. What is the next best step in the management? (NEET PG 2024)

options.label: A
options.text: Ask him to bear less weight on that leg and use plaster casts

questions.correct_answer: A. Ask him to bear less weight on that leg and use plaster casts
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Ask him to bear less weight on that leg and use plaster casts

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In the management of chronic trophic ulcers in leprosy, reducing pressure on the ulcerated area through weight redistribution, such as with a plaster cast, is essential to promote healing and prevent further complication

questions.text: A 55-year-old patient presents to the emergency department with acute shortness of breath. His heart rate is 120 beats per minute, and his BP is 80/60 mm Hg. An echocardiogram was done and reveals diastolic collapse of the right ventricle. X-ray was done and is shown. Which of the following is the most appropriate next step in the management of this patient? (NEET PG 2024)

options.label: A
options.text: Initiate diuretic therapy with blood pressure monitoring

questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Perform pericardiocentesis

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In patients presenting with signs of cardiac tamponade, immediate pericardiocentesis is the most appropriate and potentially life-saving intervention.

questions.text: Arrange the steps of the Demographic cycle in the correct chronological sequence: (NEET PG 2024) Low stationary High stationary Declining Early expanding Late expanding
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) 2 4 5 1 3

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The correct sequence of the demographic cycle stages is: High Stationary, Early Expanding, Late Expanding, Low Stationary, and Declining.

questions.text: A pregnant woman undergoes USG examination. She is found to have twins, but one-month age gap in twins on USG scan. What is this phenomenon called? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Superfetation

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Superfetation is characterized by the occurrence of two separate pregnancies in different menstrual cycles, leading to twins of different gestational ages.

questions.text: A 28-year-old woman presents with complaints of weakness and generalized fatigue. The peripheral smear shows microcytic hypochromic RBCs. Her serum iron is decreased and has increased RDW. Her MCV and MCH were also low, and TIBC was high. What would her serum transferrin saturation be? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In iron deficiency anemia, transferrin saturation is reduced (typically less than 20%) due to low serum iron and high TIBC.

questions.text: A 10-year-old child presented with knee pain following a fall from the stairs. The physical and radiological evaluation revealed injury to the marked structure. Identify the structure. (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Tibial tuberosity

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The tibial tuberosity is the site of attachment for the patellar ligament, and injuries to this region, particularly in young individuals, can result in conditions such as Osgood-Schlatter disease , characterized by pain at the site, especially following physical activity or trauma.
  • ➤ tibial tuberosity
  • ➤ Osgood-Schlatter disease

questions.text: A 54-year-old man with a history of hypertension presents with shortness of breath and palpitations. On examination, he has an irregularly irregular pulse with bilateral basal crackles. An ECG shows a ventricular response of 110/min. Which of the following statements is incorrect? (NEET PG 2024)

options.label: A
options.text: IV Digoxin can be used for ventricular rate control.

options.label: B
options.text: Direct oral anticoagulants to be given.

options.label: C
options.text: Cardioversion should be done in hemodynamically unstable patients.

options.label: D
options.text: Beta blockers are given if the patient has decompensated heart failure and intolerant to calcium channel blockers.

questions.correct_answer: D. Beta blockers are given if the patient has decompensated heart failure and intolerant to calcium channel blockers.
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Beta blockers should be avoided in patients with decompensated heart failure due to their negative inotropic effects.

questions.text: Which of the following is deficient in a patient with phenylketonuria with normal phenylalanine hydroxylase levels? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Dihydrobiopterin reductase

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In non-classical phenylketonuria, the deficiency is in dihydrobiopterin reductase, not phenylalanine hydroxylase.

questions.text: A 70-year-old man with a history of recurrent falls presented with headache and confusion. CT scan of the patient is shown. Which of the following is correct? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Chronic SDH (Subdural Hemorrhage)

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Chronic subdural hemorrhage presents as a crescent-shaped hypodense area on CT and is common in elderly patients with a history of falls or those on anticoagulant therapy.

questions.text: A patient presented with features as given in the image below.What is the likely diagnosis? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A)  Arsenic

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Mees' lines and raindrop pigmentation of the skin are classic signs of arsenic poisoning. In the absence of alopecia, arsenic is the preferred diagnosis over thallium.

questions.text: Which of the following is not a component of School Health under Ayushman Bharat Program? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Monthly IFA supplementations

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The Ayushman Bharat School Health Program includes weekly IFA supplementation, not monthly, along with other health initiatives like menstrual hygiene, deworming, screening health check-ups, physical & mental fitness, Research and Vaccination

questions.text: A young girl presented with a history of multiple episodes of loss of consciousness that lasted for 5-10 minutes. These episodes occur only in front of family members and only in the daytime. The patient can recall the conversation that happened around her during these episodes; there is no history of tongue bite and no incontinence. What is the preferred treatment? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Treat with behavioral therapy

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The preferred treatment for conversion disorder, which manifests with pseudoseizures, is behavioral therapy, not antiepileptic drugs or other seizure management strategies.

questions.text: The persistence of ADHD in childhood increases the risk of development of which of the following in adolescence? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Conduct disorder

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The persistence of ADHD in childhood significantly increases the risk of developing conduct disorder during adolescence, highlighting the need for early and effective management of ADHD symptoms.

questions.text: A child sustained a fracture after a fall. The post-op x-ray is shown below. The fracture will heal by which mechanism? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Primary healing

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Primary healing occurs with rigid fixation (such as plating) and involves direct bone formation without callus formation. Secondary healing involves callus formation and occurs when there is micromotion, typically seen with casts or nailing.
  • ➤ Primary healing occurs with rigid fixation (such as plating) and involves direct bone formation without callus formation.

questions.text: A 56-year-old female patient presented with a history of pathological fracture of the neck of femur. On lab investigations, ALP and N-telopeptide levels were raised. The DEXA scan confirmed the diagnosis as osteoporosis. Based on the lab values of osteoporosis, which other values will be raised in this patient? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Tartrate Resistant Acid Phosphatase

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Tartrate-resistant acid phosphatase (TRAP) is elevated in osteoporosis due to increased bone resorption, making it a key marker for this condition.
  • ➤ Tartrate-resistant acid phosphatase (TRAP)

questions.text: A 40-year-old man had a RTA and was admitted to a hospital. After a few days, he had an exaggerated right-sided extensor plantar reflex and knee jerk. What other finding would be seen? (NEET PG 2024)

options.label: A
options.text: Atrophy of the right lower limb

options.label: B
options.text: Loss of proprioception in the left leg

options.label: C
options.text: Ankle clonus in the right foot

questions.correct_answer: C. Ankle clonus in the right foot
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Ankle clonus in the right foot

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Brown-Sequard syndrome presents with ipsilateral loss of proprioception and upper motor neuron signs, and contralateral loss of pain and temperature sensation.

questions.text: A patient presents with xanthomas on the Achilles tendon. Which of the following is the diagnosis? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Familial hypercholesterolemia

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Familial hypercholesterolemia is associated with high LDL cholesterol levels and the presence of tendon xanthomas, particularly on the Achilles tendon

questions.text: An HIV-positive patient presented with complaints of diarrhea and foul-smelling stool. His stool microscopy did not show any ova or eggs, but there was the presence of motile 200 μm larva. Identify the organism. (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Strongyloides stercoralis

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Strongyloides stercoralis is diagnosed by the presence of motile larvae in stool, distinguishing it from other helminths that typically show eggs in stool samples.

questions.text: A 45-year-old patient presents with large, sweaty hands, macroglossia, and prominent frontal bossing. The patient also reports increasing shoe size and difficulty wearing rings that previously fit. Considering the clinical features, which of the following tests is the most appropriate initial investigation? (NEET PG 2024)

options.label: D
options.text: GH levels after 2 hours of administration of 75g glucose

questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Age-matched IGF-1 levels

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The initial test of choice for acromegaly is measuring age-matched IGF-1 levels, which serves as a reliable screening method due to its consistent reflection of GH levels over time.

questions.text: A 38-year-old woman came with complaints of weakness and lethargy with a past history of heavy menstrual bleeding. Her peripheral blood smear showed microcytic RBCs. Her lab reports are as follows - Hb 7.9 mg/dl, MCV 65, MCH - low, TIBC - increased, Transferrin saturation - low. What is the likely diagnosis? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Iron deficiency anemia

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Iron deficiency anemia presents with microcytic, hypochromic RBCs, low hemoglobin, low MCV, increased TIBC, and low transferrin saturation, often caused by chronic blood loss such as heavy menstrual bleeding.

questions.text: A child presented with leukocoria and an intraocular mass, which on histopathological examination had the presence of Flexner-Wintersteiner rosettes. Which of the following is the likely diagnosis in the child? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Retinoblastoma is identified by leukocoria, an intraocular mass in children, and the presence of Flexner-Wintersteiner rosettes on histopathology, which are true rosettes specific to this diagnosis.

questions.text: How much is the distance between the victim and the firearm from the gunshot entry based on the wound given below? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Tattooing (stippling) around a gunshot wound indicates a close contact or intermediate range. The absence of singeing or blackening suggests the firearm was not in direct contact but was fired from a short distance, such as close contact.

questions.text: Identify the maneuver? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Burn Marshall

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The Burns Marshall maneuver is characterized by gently swinging the baby over the maternal abdomen to assist in the delivery of the after-coming head in breech presentation.

questions.text: Septal perforation caused due to surgery of: (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) SMR (Submucous Resection)

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Septal perforation is a recognized complication of SMR due to the complete removal of septal cartilage and bone without replacement, which can lead to mucosal tears and eventual perforation if the layers do not heal correctly.

questions.text: For Health Education, the Motivation Model has its 1 st Step as Awareness. Its 2 nd Step is Motivation. Its 3 rd Step is: (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Action

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The third step in the Motivation Model for Health Education is Action , which signifies the adoption and implementation of the health behavior.
  • ➤ Action

questions.text: Cogwheel sign on ultrasound is seen in? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Hydrosalpinx

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The cogwheel sign on ultrasound is a key diagnostic feature of hydrosalpinx, representing the cross-sectional view of a dilated fallopian tube with internal folds.

questions.text: Which of the following conditions is most likely based on the lab values shown - Blood pH 7.28, Na 138 mEq/L, K 2.8 mEq/L, Cl 113 mEq/L, HCO3 12 mEq/L, BUN 3 mg/dL, and creatinine 0.2 mg/dL. Urinalysis showed a urinary pH of 9. Which of the following is the likely diagnosis? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Type 1 RTA (distal RTA) is identified by a combination of metabolic acidosis, hypokalemia, and an inability to acidify the urine, leading to an alkaline urinary pH, which is a distinct feature not seen in other RTAs.

questions.text: Audiogram of a patient is given. Find the sign that can be seen in the same case. (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Schwartz sign

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Carhart's notch at 2000 Hz on an audiogram is a specific finding in otosclerosis, and Schwartz sign, a reddish hue behind the tympanic membrane, is an associated clinical sign indicating active otosclerotic processes.

questions.text: A farmer is on a maize-based diet and develops skin rashes on the face, neck, and hand. Which of the following should be given? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Niacin

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Niacin deficiency in individuals consuming a maize-based diet can lead to pellagra, characterized by dermatitis, diarrhea, and dementia. Niacin supplementation is the treatment of choice.

questions.text: A 4-year-old boy presents with multiple patches of hair loss which was associated with itching and scaling. His 2-year-old sister also had similar complaints. What is the most likely diagnosis? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Tinea capitis

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Tinea capitis is a contagious fungal infection that presents with patchy hair loss, itching, and scaling, particularly in children, and can spread among family members.

questions.text: An elderly male presented to the clinic with fatigue, headache, backache, and renal dysfunction. He had elevated calcium levels also. His serum electrophoresis had an M spike and the immunofixation pattern has been presented alongside. What is the likely diagnosis in the patient? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.correct_answer: D. Multiple myeloma with elevated IgM
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Multiple myeloma with elevated IgM

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ An M spike on serum electrophoresis along with specific symptoms and immunofixation identifying elevated IgM indicates a diagnosis of multiple myeloma or a related plasma cell cancer, such as lymphoplasmacytic lymphoma (Waldenström's macroglobulinemia).

questions.text: Which of the following statements about Ciclesonide is incorrect? (NEET PG 2024)

options.label: A
options.text: Oral candidiasis is common with its use.

options.label: B
options.text: It has fewer side effects than other inhalational corticosteroids.

options.label: C
options.text: It is a prodrug activated by bronchial esterase.

options.label: D
options.text: It has comparable efficacy to other inhalational corticosteroids.

questions.correct_answer: A. Oral candidiasis is common with its use.
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Oral candidiasis is common with its use.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Ciclesonide, a prodrug inhalational corticosteroid, has a lower risk of causing oral candidiasis compared to other inhalational steroids because it remains inactive until it reaches the lungs, where it is activated by bronchial esterases.

questions.text: Which drug would be most effective in preventing withdrawal symptoms in a patient with a history of alcohol consumption who was admitted to the hospital after a road traffic accident? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Lorazepam

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Benzodiazepines, such as lorazepam, are the drugs of choice to prevent and manage alcohol withdrawal symptoms.

questions.text: What is true about this position? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A)

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The sniffing position aligns the oral, pharyngeal, and laryngeal axes, making it the ideal position for tracheal intubation

questions.text: A 35-year-old female presented with the following lesion. The abnormality seen following the lesion is: (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Craniopharyngiomas commonly cause bitemporal hemianopia due to compression of the optic chiasm, resulting in peripheral vision loss on both sides.

questions.text: On the promontory, behind the tympanic membrane, there is a red mass. CT is given. What is the diagnosis? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The presence of a red mass on the promontory behind the tympanic membrane, with an absent caroticojugular spine on CT (felp sign), indicates a diagnosis of glomus jugulare.

questions.text: A patient presented with pus discharge from the urethra and dysuria. He had a history of unprotected sexual intercourse. Identify the following organism: (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Neisseria gonorrhoeae is a Gram-negative diplococcus that causes gonorrhea, characterized by urethral discharge and dysuria, especially following unprotected sexual intercourse.

questions.text: Identify the type of inhibition exhibited by A. (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans.  A) Competitive inhibition

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Competitive inhibition is identified by an increased Km and unchanged Vmax, with intersecting lines on the y-axis of the Lineweaver-Burk plot

questions.text: A 25-year-old woman with primary infertility is found to have bilateral tubal block on HSG. The next best step is? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Laparoscopy with chromotubation

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ After identifying a bilateral tubal block on HSG in a woman with primary infertility, the next best step is to confirm the diagnosis with laparoscopy and chromotubation before considering other treatments like IVF.

questions.text: The shown epithelium is seen in: (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Ureter

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Transitional epithelium, marked by umbrella cells and multilayered structure, is primarily found in the urinary tract, including the ureter, where it facilitates expansion and contraction.

questions.text: Which of the following is a true/correct statement about paroxysmal nocturnal hemoglobinuria? (NEET PG 2024)

options.label: A
options.text: It is an inherited red blood cell disorder causing intravascular hemolysis

options.label: B
options.text: The diagnosis of the disorder is confirmed by sucrose lysis test

options.label: C
options.text: Flow cytometry is the gold standard for diagnosing this condition

options.label: D
options.text: The commonest cause of mortality is cardiac failure

questions.correct_answer: C. Flow cytometry is the gold standard for diagnosing this condition
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Flow cytometry is the definitive test for diagnosing PNH by demonstrating the absence of CD55 and CD59 on blood cells.

questions.text: Why is atropine mixed with diphenoxylate in combination medications? (NEET PG 2024)

options.label: A
options.text: Atropine decreases the adverse effect of diphenoxylate

questions.correct_answer: B. To prevent abuse of diphenoxylate
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) To prevent abuse of diphenoxylate

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Atropine is added to diphenoxylate to prevent the abuse of the opioid component by causing unpleasant side effects if the medication is taken in large doses, thereby discouraging misuse.

questions.text: A 30-year-old patient presented with GTCS (Generalized Tonic-Clonic Seizures) and was admitted. CECT is shown below. Which of the following can be useful in establishing the diagnosis? (NEET PG 2024)

options.label: D
options.text: B scan of both the eyes

questions.explanation:
Ans. C) NMR spectroscopy

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ NMR spectroscopy is valuable in distinguishing between tuberculoma and neurocysticercosis, especially when a single ring-enhancing lesion is present on imaging.

questions.text: An intra-operative image of a child undergoing inguinal hernia repair is shown, with a marked vein in the spermatic cord. What is the likely structure? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Testicular vein

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In an open inguinal hernia repair, the primary veins associated with the spermatic cord are the testicular veins. Other veins such as the femoral, obturator, and inferior epigastric veins are located posterior to the inguinal canal and are not seen within the spermatic cord during such procedures.

questions.text: During examination of a patient with an intern, the professor asks the patient to invert his foot and he points at the prominent tendon behind the medial malleolus. Which is the tendon being pointed at here? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Tibialis posterior

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:

questions.text: Identify the correct order of End plate potential at the neuromuscular junction: (NEET PG 2024)

options.label: A
options.text: Ca2+ entry in Axon Terminal → Ach Release → Ligand gated Na+ channel opens → Action potential at motor end plate

options.label: B
options.text: Ligand gated Na+ channel opens → Action potential at motor end plate→ Ca2+ entry in Axon Terminal → Ach Release

options.label: C
options.text: Ach Release → Ligand gated Na+ channel opens → Action potential at motor end plate → Ca2+ entry in Axon Terminal

options.label: D
options.text: Action potential at motor end plate → Ca2+ entry in Axon Terminal → Ach Release → Ligand gated Na+ channel opens

questions.correct_answer: A. Ca2+ entry in Axon Terminal → Ach Release → Ligand gated Na+ channel opens → Action potential at motor end plate
questions.explanation:
Ans. A. Ca2+ entry in Axon Terminal → Ach Release → Ligand gated Na+ channel opens → Action potential at motor end plate

Explanation:

  • • Explanation:
  • • At the neuromuscular junction (NMJ), the sequence of events leading to muscle contraction begins with the binding of acetylcholine (Ach) to its receptors on the motor end plate. This binding opens ligand-gated Na⁺ channels, allowing an influx of sodium ions, which depolarizes the muscle membrane and generates an action potential. The action potential travels along the motor neuron to the axon terminal, where it triggers the opening of voltage-gated Ca²⁺ channels. The entry of calcium ions into the axon terminal facilitates the exocytosis of Ach into the synaptic cleft, which then binds to receptors on the muscle fiber to propagate the signal for muscle contraction.
  • • Other Options:
  • • Other Options:
  • • Option B. Ligand-gated Na⁺ channel opens → Action potential at motor end plate → Ca²⁺ entry in Axon Terminal → Ach Release: This sequence incorrectly initiates with the opening of ligand-gated Na⁺ channels before Ach is released. In reality, Ach must first be released to bind to these channels and cause their opening.
  • • Option B. Ligand-gated Na⁺ channel opens → Action potential at motor end plate → Ca²⁺ entry in Axon Terminal → Ach Release:
  • • Option C. Ach Release → Ligand-gated Na⁺ channel opens → Action potential at motor end plate → Ca²⁺ entry in Axon Terminal: Ach release is a result of Ca²⁺ entry, not the initial step. This option reverses the correct order of events.
  • • Option C. Ach Release → Ligand-gated Na⁺ channel opens → Action potential at motor end plate → Ca²⁺ entry in Axon Terminal:
  • • Option D. Action potential at motor end plate → Ca²⁺ entry in Axon Terminal → Ach Release → Ligand-gated Na⁺ channel opens: This sequence incorrectly places the action potential at the motor end plate before Ach release. The action potential at the motor end plate is a result of Ach binding, not the precursor to Ca²⁺ entry.
  • • Option D. Action potential at motor end plate → Ca²⁺ entry in Axon Terminal → Ach Release → Ligand-gated Na⁺ channel opens:

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The correct sequence at the neuromuscular junction is:
  • ➤ The correct sequence at the neuromuscular junction
  • ➤ Ca2+ entry in Axon Terminal → Ach Release → Ligand gated Na+ channel opens → Action potential at motor end plate

  • ➤ Taste buds are absent
  • ➤ filiform papillae
  • ➤ most numerous and smallest
  • ➤ dorsal surface

questions.text: A 56-year-old woman presented with chronic low back pain. CT scan of the lower back showed the following. Diagnose the condition CT scan image shown? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Spondylolisthesis

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Spondylolisthesis involves the slipping of one vertebra over another, typically visualized in imaging studies. The "beheaded dog" or "Scottish terrier sign" is a key radiographic feature of this condition.

questions.text: What is the likely diagnosis based on the MRCP image? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans.  A) Choledochal cyst

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ A fusiform dilatation of the common bile duct on MRCP is characteristic of a Type 1 choledochal cyst, the most common type of choledochal cyst.

questions.text: A 32-year-old female in late pregnancy presents with seizures and high-grade blood pressure. She is diagnosed with eclampsia and started on magnesium sulfate therapy. As part of her management, certain parameters require close monitoring to prevent magnesium toxicity. Which of the following parameters does not require routine checking during magnesium sulfate therapy in this patient? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Serum magnesium levels

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ While managing eclampsia with magnesium sulfate, routine monitoring of deep tendon reflexes, urine output, and respiratory rate is crucial. Serum magnesium levels are only checked if toxicity is suspected, not as a routine measure.

questions.text: Identify the marked nerve. (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The medial pectoral nerve is the nerve that pierces the pectoralis minor muscle and also provides innervation to the pectoralis major.

questions.text: What is the optimum pressure for VAC? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) 100 to 130 mm of Hg

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The optimum pressure for Vacuum-Assisted Closure therapy is between 100 to 130 mm Hg, with -125 mm Hg being the most commonly used setting to promote effective wound healing.

questions.text: Patient experiences softening of the cervix in early pregnancy. This sign is called as? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Goodell

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Goodell's sign is the softening of the cervix, observed in early pregnancy due to increased vascularity, which makes the cervix feel soft, like the lips, compared to its usual firm texture

questions.text: True regarding Oral Cholera vaccine ‘Sanchol’ is: (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Bivalent with 2 doses

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ CHOLERA ORAL VACCINES:
  • ➤ CHOLERA ORAL VACCINES:
  • ➤ Dukoral (WC-rBS): Monovalent, V cholera O1 plus Recombinant Toxin B subunit. 2 doses (if age ≥6 years) and booster once/ 2 years 3 doses (if age b/w 2-5 years) and booster dose once per 6 months. Sanchol and mORCVAX: Bivalent, Serogroups O1 & O139, No toxin B subunit, No buffer required. 2 liquid doses after the age of 1 year and booster after 2 years. Euvichol: it is just like Sanchol. Bivalent with 2 doses.
  • ➤ Dukoral (WC-rBS): Monovalent, V cholera O1 plus Recombinant Toxin B subunit. 2 doses (if age ≥6 years) and booster once/ 2 years 3 doses (if age b/w 2-5 years) and booster dose once per 6 months.
  • ➤ 2 doses (if age ≥6 years) and booster once/ 2 years 3 doses (if age b/w 2-5 years) and booster dose once per 6 months.

  • ➤ Euvichol: it is just like Sanchol. Bivalent with 2 doses.

questions.text: A patient with gastrointestinal symptoms and neurological symptoms underwent a blood examination whose peripheral smear image is provided here. What is the likely diagnosis in this patient? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Abetalipoproteinemia

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Acanthocytes, or spur cells, are red blood cells with irregular, spiky projections associated with abetalipoproteinemia, a disorder characterized by fat malabsorption, vitamin deficiencies, and neurological symptoms.

questions.text: A 5-year-old girl was washing her doll with shampoo containing rotenone. Her mother noticed her in an unconscious state. Which is inhibited by the above chemical? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Rotenone specifically inhibits Complex I also known as NADH CoQ oxidoreductase (NADH dehydrogenase) in the electron transport chain, blocking electron flow and ATP production.

questions.text: Which of the following are Methanol poisoning derivatives? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Formic acid + Lactic acid

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Methanol poisoning primarily results in the formation of formic acid and lactic acid as toxic metabolites.

questions.text: Which of the following is not a contraindication to the procedure shown? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Primigravida

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Primigravida is not a contraindication for ECV, though it may be technically more challenging compared to multiparous women. Key contraindications to ECV include placenta previa, multiple pregnancy, and ruptured membranes.

questions.text: An adolescent male came with complaints of lesions all over the face and back, which were predominantly comedones. What is the most effective treatment for this condition? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Systemic doxycycline

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Systemic doxycycline is the most effective treatment for moderate to severe acne that involves comedones and inflammatory lesions, particularly when the condition is extensive.

questions.text: In a case of RTA (Road Traffic Accident), a person has died. Who can order an autopsy? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Police Officer

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The Police Officer, specifically the Investigating Officer, has the authority to order an autopsy in cases of unexplained or suspicious deaths, such as those resulting from a road traffic accident.

questions.text: A patient suffered from severe chest pain and expired. Which of the following is the likely age of infarct from the image of the cardiac biopsy shown here? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) 1 day

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Brisk neutrophilic infiltration is a characteristic finding in myocardial tissue within the first 24 hours of infarction. The peak of neutrophil presence occurs around the second and third days , followed by the transition to macrophages.
  • ➤ The peak of neutrophil presence occurs
  • ➤ around the second and third days

questions.text: A patient presented with a renal stone after a Proteus infection. What is the likely composition of the stone in him? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Magnesium ammonium phosphate

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Magnesium ammonium phosphate (struvite) stones are commonly formed in alkaline urine due to urease-positive bacterial infections, such as those caused by Proteus. They often present as staghorn calculi filling the renal pelvis and calyces.

questions.text: Identify the image. (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Fluoroscopy

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Fluoroscopy is a dynamic X-ray imaging technique used to visualize the motion of the pharynx and esophagus during swallowing. It provides real-time assessment, unlike a static barium swallow.

questions.text: A 26-year-old female patient complains of a nodular lesion near the limbus as shown, with mild discomfort that resolves after treatment with the use of a topical drug. What can be the most probable diagnosis? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Episcleritis presents as a mildly uncomfortable, nodular lesion near the limbus that responds to topical treatment, such as phenylephrine, and is often associated with autoimmune conditions like rheumatoid arthritis.

questions.text: A lot of patients presented to PHC OPD with edema, ocular problems, cardiac failure. Several deaths were reported too. There was a common history of buying oil from a local grocery store. Drug inspector will use the following test to detect adulteration. (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Paper chromatography test

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Epidemic dropsy is caused by the consumption of mustard oil adulterated with Argemone Mexicana oil, and the most sensitive test for detecting this adulteration is the paper chromatography test.

questions.text: A boy born to a normal father and mother had Hemophilia. Detailed history taking revealed that the mother's side had a family history of similar affected individuals. The children born to this boy are likely to have which of the following? (NEET PG 2024)

options.label: A
options.text: All boys and girl children equally affected

options.label: B
options.text: 50% boys affected and no girl children unaffected

options.label: C
options.text: No boy affected and 50% girl children are carrier

options.label: D
options.text: 25% boy affected and 25% girl children are carrier

questions.correct_answer: C. No boy affected and 50% girl children are carrier
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) No boy affected and 50% girl children are carrier

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In X-linked recessive disorders like hemophilia, affected males do not transmit the condition to their sons, but their daughters have a 50% chance of being carriers.

questions.text: The longitudinal growth of the bone is affected by fracture of which region of the bone? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Epiphyseal plate

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The epiphyseal plate is the region of the bone responsible for longitudinal growth, and fractures affecting this area can have significant implications on the bone's growth and development.
  • ➤ epiphyseal plate

questions.text: What is the likely diagnosis? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Lung Abscess

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ A lung abscess is identified by a cavity with an air-fluid level on imaging, differentiating it from other pulmonary conditions like TB, fungal infections, and hydropneumothorax.

questions.text: A 50-year-old male presented with tearing pain in the chest that intensely radiated to his back. He had non-specific ECG changes and his Trop I was negative. During the course of his evaluation he passed away. Biopsy of the aorta obtained during autopsy is shown. What is the likely mechanism behind his disease? (NEET PG 2024)

options.label: B
options.text: Subintimal lipid infiltration with smooth muscle necrosis

questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The most likely mechanism behind aortic dissection is connective tissue weakness in the aortic wall.

questions.text: The treatment given to the patient presenting with a history of binge alcohol intake and symptoms of convulsions, altered sensorium, and plasma glucose level of 45 mg/dL is: (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Thiamine followed by dextrose

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In alcohol-related hypoglycemia, always administer thiamine before dextrose to prevent the exacerbation of thiamine deficiency and associated complications.

questions.text: A patient presented with sudden, painful diminution of vision, difficulty in vision in light, and circumferential congestion with hypopyon as shown. What is the likely diagnosis? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Acute Anterior Uveitis

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Acute Anterior Uveitis is characterized by a painful red eye, circumcorneal congestion, hypopyon, and a miotic pupil, distinguishing it from other ocular conditions.

questions.text: A 2-year-old child presented with watery diarrhea and vomiting. Electron microscopy showed the following image. Identify the organism: (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Rotavirus is the most common cause of severe diarrhea in young children and is characterized by its distinctive wheel-like appearance on electron microscopy.

questions.text: Which ion is most responsible for the resting membrane potential (RMP): (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The resting membrane potential is primarily determined by the concentration gradient of potassium ions (K+) across the cell membrane and the membrane's permeability to K+.

questions.text: Identify: (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Venous ulcers are typically found on the medial aspect of the lower leg, above the medial malleolus, and are associated with chronic venous insufficiency. Recognizing their characteristic location and appearance is crucial for diagnosis.

questions.text: A patient being treated for hypertriglyceridemia developed flushing, gout, hyperglycemia, and raised liver enzymes. Which drug is the most likely cause? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Nicotinamide

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Nicotinamide (niacin) is associated with flushing, gout, hyperglycemia, and raised liver enzymes, making it the likely cause of these symptoms in a patient being treated for hypertriglyceridemia

questions.text: Identify the procedure based on the image: (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Nissen Fundoplication

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Nissen Fundoplication is a surgical procedure involving a complete 360-degree wrap of the gastric fundus around the lower esophagus to prevent gastroesophageal reflux. It is distinct from other partial fundoplication techniques such as Toupet and Dor, which involve less than a full wrap.

questions.text: A patient complains of decreased sensation in the lateral 3 ½ fingers of the palmar side of the right hand along with difficulty moving the upper phalanx of the thumb. Associated thenar atrophy is also present. What is the associated nerve injury in this case? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The high median nerve injury is characterized by sensory loss in the lateral 3 ½ fingers on the palmar side, difficulty moving the thumb, and associated thenar atrophy.

questions.text: A 25-year-old male presented to the emergency department with head trauma due to a road traffic accident. In the hospital, the patient developed seizures. An emergency CT scan revealed widespread cerebral edema. Which of the following is the diuretic of choice for cerebral edema in this patient? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Mannitol

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Mannitol is the diuretic of choice for treating cerebral edema, particularly in emergency settings following traumatic brain injury, due to its ability to reduce intracranial pressure by drawing fluid out of the brain tissue.
  • ➤ Mannitol is the diuretic of choice for treating cerebral edema,

questions.text: A female presented with a long history of fever, discolored skin of lower limbs, and lower limb edema. Microscopic examination showed a sheathed organism with no nuclei at the tip of the tail. What can be the most likely diagnosis? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ For a patient presenting with symptoms of lymphatic filariasis and a sheathed microfilaria with no tail tip nuclei, Wuchereria bancrofti is the most likely diagnosis.

questions.text: A young athlete was diagnosed to have HOCM and has a harsh ejection systolic murmur. Which of the following maneuvers would most likely increase the intensity of the murmur? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Valsalva maneuver

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In HOCM, maneuvers that decrease preload (like the Valsalva maneuver) will increase the intensity of the murmur, while those that increase preload or afterload will decrease it.

questions.text: 2 hours after watching a movie, a patient presented with eye ache and difficulty in vision. The first line of management must be: (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Mannitol + Pilocarpine

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The first-line management of acute angle-closure glaucoma involves the use of Mannitol to reduce intraocular pressure followed by Pilocarpine to constrict the pupil and prevent further angle obstruction.

questions.text: A patient presented with redness and extreme pain in the eye. There is also diminution of vision and discharge after the use of contact lenses. Which organism can be the causative agent here? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Acanthamoeba keratitis is characterized by severe pain that exceeds clinical findings and is often associated with contact lens misuse, presenting with a distinctive ring-shaped corneal ulcer.

questions.text: A lady presented with a pelvic mass which was hyperintense on T1-weighted image, hyperintense on T1-fat saturated image, and hypointense on T2-weighted image with T2 shading. What is the likely diagnosis? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Endometrioma

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Endometriomas are characterized by T1 hyperintensity that persists on T1-fat saturated images and display the T2 shading sign, distinguishing them from other ovarian masses.

questions.text: There were 4000 live births in a community in a year. Do MMR Calculation if you come to know that 6 women died during pregnancy, labor/delivery, or within 42 days of delivery - 2 due to Obstructed labor, 1 due to Sepsis, 1 due to PPH, 1 due to Snake bite and 1 due to electrocution. (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) 100

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The Maternal Mortality Ratio (MMR) is calculated as the number of maternal deaths per 100,000 live births, considering only deaths directly related to pregnancy or its complications.

questions.text: A 65-year-old man presented with acute epigastric pain and nausea. Lab reports showed an increase in serum lipase levels. He received 2L of fluids during admission, and three days after stabilization, he developed sudden breathlessness. Chest X-ray is shown. What is the likely diagnosis?(NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ ARDS is a potential severe complication of acute pancreatitis, presenting with non-cardiogenic pulmonary edema characterized by bilateral infiltrates and normal PCWP

questions.text: Arrange the steps of the Disaster cycle in sequence. (NEET PG 2024)
questions.correct_answer: B. Disaster impact – Response – Rehabilitation – Mitigation
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Disaster impact – Response – Rehabilitation – Mitigation

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The correct sequence of the disaster cycle is: Disaster Impact → Response → Rehabilitation → Mitigation.

questions.text: A study was undertaken to evaluate the association between the consumption of vegetarian/non-vegetarian food with certain diseases. The incidence of disease was evaluated in those two groups. Which statistical test should be applied to test significance? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Chi-square test

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The Chi-square test is used to determine the association between categorical variables, especially when comparing the incidence of outcomes across two or more independent groups.

questions.text: Nugent score is for diagnosis of? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The Nugent score is used for the diagnosis of bacterial vaginosis . It is a microbiological scoring system where the vaginal smear is analyzed for the number of lactobacilli and abnormal bacteria. The clinical scoring system for bacterial vaginosis is the Amsel's criteria , which includes the whiff test, clue cells, alkaline pH, and whitish discharge.
  • ➤ Nugent score
  • ➤ bacterial vaginosis
  • ➤ Amsel's criteria

questions.text: The oocyte phase in post-ovulation is: (NEET PG 2024)

options.label: A
options.text: Primary oocyte arrested in prophase – I

options.label: B
options.text: Secondary oocyte completed in prophase – II

options.label: C
options.text: Primary oocyte arrested in prophase – II

options.label: D
options.text: Secondary oocyte arrested in metaphase – II

questions.correct_answer: D. Secondary oocyte arrested in metaphase – II
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Secondary oocyte arrested in metaphase – II

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The secondary oocyte is arrested in metaphase II at the time of ovulation and remains in this stage until fertilization occurs, highlighting a critical regulatory checkpoint in the female reproductive cycle.
  • ➤ secondary oocyte
  • ➤ metaphase II

questions.text: A 5-year-old girl has a greyish white membrane over tonsils and presented with bull-neck appearance. She has a 2-year-old brother who is fully immunized for his age. What should be given to the brother? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In managing contacts of diphtheria, no additional doses are required if the contact has received primary immunization or booster within the last 2 years.

questions.text: Identify the image. (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Fibroids are well-defined, circumscribed lesions within the uterine cavity that are distinct in color and structure compared to surrounding myometrial tissue, distinguishing them from other uterine conditions like adenomyosis, polyps, and cancer.

questions.text: What is the likely diagnosis? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans.  A) Abscess

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Brain abscesses present as ring-enhancing lesions with diffusion restriction on diffusion-weighted imaging (DWI), appearing bright white on DWI due to restricted water movement caused by pus accumulation.

questions.text: A 62-year-old patient presents with left-sided arm and leg weakness, right-sided facial paralysis, and horizontal gaze palsy. Based on the clinical presentation, which of the following is most consistent with the diagnosis? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Foville syndrome

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Foville syndrome involves contralateral hemiparesis, ipsilateral cranial nerve palsies, and horizontal gaze palsy due to brainstem involvement, distinguishing it from other stroke syndromes.

questions.text: A patient presents with a perforation in the tympanic membrane. During the evaluation, a Rinne test is performed. What is the expected outcome of the Rinne test in this case? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Negative

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ A perforation in the tympanic membrane causes conductive hearing loss, which is characterized by a negative Rinne test, where bone conduction is heard louder than air conduction.

questions.text: A young male came with GI complaints like malabsorption, diarrhea. Cutaneous examination noted itchy lesions on the skin with blistering. On histopathology, cryptitis and flattened villi were noted. His condition improved with a gluten-free diet. What is the specific antibody in this condition? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Tissue Transglutaminase 3 (ttg-3)

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The presence of tissue transglutaminase 3 (ttg-3) antibodies is a hallmark of dermatitis herpetiformis, a condition associated with celiac disease. This autoimmune response is triggered by gluten ingestion and manifests with both gastrointestinal and cutaneous symptoms.

questions.text: A patient from Bihar was admitted with massive splenomegaly, on-off fever, anemia, and features of leishmaniasis. The vector causing it is: (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Phlebotomus

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Leishmaniasis, particularly visceral leishmaniasis (kala-azar), is transmitted by the Phlebotomus species, also known as sandflies.

questions.text: An individual went to the US and developed an infection. LPCB mount showed the following. Identify the cause. (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Histoplasma capsulatum

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Histoplasma capsulatum is identified by its distinctive tuberculate macroconidia on LPCB mounts, which is a key feature to recognize this dimorphic fungus, especially in infections contracted in the United States.

questions.text: A person was taking an antihypertensive drug and continued taking it despite developing constipation, dry mouth, and dizziness. He was taking it regularly but forgot to take it during a trip abroad and has now developed a hypertensive emergency. Which antihypertensive was he likely taking? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Clonidine

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Clonidine is an antihypertensive medication that can cause dry mouth, constipation, and dizziness, and sudden discontinuation can lead to rebound hypertension, making it crucial for patients to maintain consistent dosing.

questions.text: Which of the following drugs, when given with erythromycin, can cause QT prolongation and Torsades de pointes? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Astemizole, when combined with erythromycin, can cause QT prolongation and Torsades de pointes due to its significant effect on cardiac potassium channels, posing a high risk of life-threatening arrhythmias.

questions.text: A 6-year-old child presents to the emergency department with sudden onset of palpitations, shortness of breath, and dizziness. The child has no significant past medical history. On examination, the heart rate is 220 beats per minute, blood pressure is 90/60 mmHg, and the child appears anxious but is otherwise stable. An ECG confirms the diagnosis of paroxysmal supraventricular tachycardia (PSVT). What is the initial recommended dose of adenosine for this child? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) 0.1 mg/kg

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The initial recommended dose of adenosine for treating PSVT in children is 0.1 mg/kg, with a maximum dose of 6 mg. If the initial dose is ineffective, a higher dose of 0.2 mg/kg may be administered.

questions.text: Diagnose the image seen in a 10-year-old child. (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Herbert pits are characteristic depressions found in the cornea due to the rupture of follicles, commonly seen in trachoma.

questions.text: A 30-year-old male presented for evaluation. During the session, he was quite charming, and there is a history of him behaving nicely with family members. However, he often gets in fights with friends. He was also involved in multiple police cases. What is the likely diagnosis? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Antisocial personality

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Antisocial Personality Disorder is characterized by a pattern of disregard for others' rights, often involving legal issues, deceitful behavior, and superficial charm.

questions.text: Which of the following statements is NOT true about the given image? (NEET PG 2024)

options.label: A
options.text: Improves on treatment of thyroid status

options.label: B
options.text: Vision loss may be seen in some cases

questions.correct_answer: A. Improves on treatment of thyroid status
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Thyroid eye disease is primarily an immune-mediated condition that does not directly improve with the management of thyroid hormone levels; its treatment focuses on controlling inflammation through immunosuppressive therapies.

questions.text: What type of budding is described by a broad base with a small bud coming off of it, often associated with a figure of 8 appearances? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Blastomycosis

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Blastomycosis is characterized by broad-based budding with a figure of 8 appearances, where the term "Blasto" helps recall the broad base nature of the budding structure.

questions.text: Implantation of the embryo takes place how many days after fertilization? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) 8

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Implantation of the embryo begins around day 5 to 6 and is completed by day 8 to 9 after fertilization.

questions.text: Common site for congenital diaphragmatic hernia is: (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The most common site for congenital diaphragmatic hernia is the posterolateral region, predominantly on the left side, known as the Bochdalek hernia.

questions.text: All are the members of the medical board in MTP > 24 weeks, except? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Legal advisor

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In MTP cases beyond 24 weeks, the medical board consists of medical professionals such as radiologists, gynecologists, and pediatricians, but not legal advisors.

questions.text: Patient with high triglycerides esterified with long chain fatty acid (LCFA) presents with fatigue and biopsy of muscle shows fat vacuoles. Which of the following is the diagnosis? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Carnitine deficiency

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Carnitine is essential for the transport of long-chain fatty acids into the mitochondria for beta-oxidation. Deficiency in carnitine leads to the accumulation of triglycerides esterified with long-chain fatty acids in muscle tissues, causing fatigue and exercise intolerance

questions.text: Which of the following is a marker of Alzheimer disease? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Amyloid beta plaque is a key pathological marker of Alzheimer’s disease, contributing significantly to the neurodegenerative changes seen in this condition.

questions.text: Diagnose the following radiograph. (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Arnold Chiari malformation

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Arnold Chiari malformation is identified by the herniation of the cerebellar tonsils through the foramen magnum, visible on MRI scans as the downward displacement of cerebellar tissue.

questions.text: Which nerve supplies the hybrid muscle partially spared in a patient who presented with sciatica and tender hamstrings? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Quick revision of the hybrid muscles of the upper and lower limbs:
  • ➤ hybrid muscles

questions.text: Identify the mediastinal mass shown in the image. The measured Hounsfield unit in the mass revealed -70 HU. (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Teratoma

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Negative Hounsfield Unit values (between -10 to -100) indicate the presence of fat within a lesion, suggesting that the mass could be a teratoma, especially when accompanied by calcifications.

questions.text: A patient had a blunt injury to the abdomen after an RTA and underwent ileal resection. He recovered well post-surgery but months later presents with fatigue and exercise intolerance. Which of the following will not be seen? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Microcytic hypochromic anemia

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Ileal resection can lead to vitamin B12 deficiency, which manifests as megaloblastic anemia (macrocytic) and neurological symptoms like subacute combined degeneration.

questions.text: A patient came with complaints of vesicular oral lesions, and on skin sample, DIF showed a fishnet pattern as given below. What is the most likely diagnosis? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Pemphigus vulgaris

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Pemphigus vulgaris is associated with a characteristic "fishnet" pattern on direct immunofluorescence due to IgG deposition along keratinocyte cell membranes. Recognizing this pattern is crucial for diagnosis.

questions.text: Which of the following is suggestive of pseudomembranous colitis? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Pseudomembranous colitis is characterized by the presence of yellowish pseudomembranes and ulcers in the colon, often caused by Clostridium difficile overgrowth.

questions.text: Which defect is shown below? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Homonymous hemianopia is characterized by the loss of the same side of the visual field in both eyes and is typically caused by lesions in the contralateral optic tract, optic radiation, or occipital lobe.

questions.text: A patient present at 10 weeks pregnancy. She asks for medical method of abortion. What will you advise her? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Mifepristone and misoprostol

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ For a medical abortion at 10 weeks, the recommended regimen is mifepristone followed by misoprostol, as it is effective and safe up to 12 weeks of gestation according to WHO guidelines.

questions.text: This position is given in which patients? (NEET PG 2024)

options.label: C
options.text: Unconscious with Pulse present Breathing present

options.label: D
options.text: Conscious with Pulse present Breathing present

questions.correct_answer: C. Unconscious with Pulse present Breathing present
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Unconscious with Pulse present Breathing present

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The recovery position is used for unconscious patients who have a pulse and are breathing, to maintain airway patency and prevent aspiration.

questions.text: An infectious disease has its incubation period as 5-14 days, with its median incubation period being 10 days. The quarantine of contacts traveling to a new country should be done for: (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) 14 days

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Quarantine should be conducted for the maximum incubation period of the infectious disease to ensure that symptoms will manifest within that time, confirming whether a contact becomes a case.

questions.text: The time gap between entry of organism in human body and its maximal infectivity is: (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Generation time

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Generation time is the interval between the entry of an organism into the body and the point of maximal infectivity.

questions.text: A 1-week-old child was presented with early cataract. He also has refusal to feed, vomiting, lethargy, jaundice, and sepsis. This can be caused due to the deficiency of which enzyme? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Classic galactosemia is caused by a deficiency of galactose-1-phosphate uridyltransferase and presents with early cataracts, feeding difficulties, vomiting, lethargy, jaundice, and sepsis in newborns.

questions.text: A 30-year-old man had an episode of jaundice due to HBV one year back. On follow-up now, he has normal levels of liver enzymes. His current profile is shown in the image. What is the diagnosis for his current condition? (NEET PG 2024)

options.label: A
options.text: Chronic Hepatitis B with HBeAg negative

options.label: B
options.text: Chronic Hepatitis B with HBeAg positive

questions.correct_answer: B. Chronic Hepatitis B with HBeAg positive
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Chronic Hepatitis B is defined by the persistence of HBsAg for more than six months. The presence of HBeAg indicates active viral replication, characterizing the infection as HBeAg positive.

questions.text: Which type of translocation is seen in diaphyseal tumor with small blue round cells? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) T11, 22

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The t(11;22) translocation is characteristic of Ewing's sarcoma , a diaphyseal tumor with small, round, blue cells, making it a crucial genetic marker for diagnosis.
  • ➤ t(11;22) translocation
  • ➤ Ewing's sarcoma

questions.text: What is the diagnosis? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Chronic pancreatitis

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Chronic pancreatitis is characterized by pancreatic calcifications on imaging, which are absent in acute pancreatitis and other conditions like Wolman disease or TB.

questions.text: A football player had a twisting injury of the knee with no clinical bony injury. Which test is being performed here? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Lachman’s test

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Lachman’s test is the most reliable physical exam maneuver for diagnosing ACL tears, performed with the knee in 20-30 degrees of flexion.

questions.text: A G3P2L1NND1 presents at 37 weeks with previous 2 LSCS with primary active HSV. What is the next best step? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Active herpes simplex virus infection during labor is an indication for a cesarean section to prevent neonatal transmission.

questions.text: Identify the image: (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C)

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Bier’s block, or intravenous regional anesthesia (IVRA), is used for anesthetizing a limb by injecting local anesthetic into a vein while using a tourniquet to confine the anesthetic to the limb.

questions.text: A 2-month-old baby presented with the following symptoms. What is the ideal treatment for the child? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ For a 2-month-old presenting with leukocoria, immediate surgery is the ideal treatment to prevent amblyopia and ensure proper visual development.

questions.text: Which are the tumor markers for the ultrasound image shown below? (NEET PG 2024) CA 125 LDH AFP hCG CA 19-9
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) 1,2,3,4,5

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Different tumor markers, including CA 125, LDH, AFP, hCG, and CA 19-9, are utilized to assess ovarian masses and differentiate between various types of ovarian tumors.

questions.text: Identify this instrument used in the delivery of the aftercoming head in breech. (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Piper forceps

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Piper forceps are the instrument of choice for the delivery of the aftercoming head in breech presentations due to their specialized design that facilitates safe extraction.

questions.text: Which disease the girl is related to and what's her name? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Sapna, Leprosy

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Sapna is a character created to promote leprosy awareness and emphasize that leprosy is a 100% curable disease.

questions.text: A patient consumed a toxic substance and presented with tachycardia, tachypnea, hypertension, and hypocalcemia. What is the likely diagnosis? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Ethylene Glycol

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Ethylene glycol poisoning is characterized by hypocalcemia due to the formation of calcium oxalate crystals and presents with symptoms such as tachycardia, tachypnea, and hypertension.

questions.text: Match the following : (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) A-SVC, B-Aorta, C-Trachea, D-Esophagus

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ When identifying structures on a chest CT, it's crucial to accurately recognize the anatomical positions of key structures like the superior vena cava, aorta, trachea, and esophagus based on their appearance and location in cross-sectional imaging.

questions.text: Which of the following statements is true regarding an esophageal foreign body? (NEET PG 2024)

options.label: C
options.text: Most common site of impaction is at the level of cricopharyngeus

options.label: D
options.text: One of the constrictions of the esophagus is at the level of the right bronchus

questions.correct_answer: C. Most common site of impaction is at the level of cricopharyngeus
questions.explanation:
Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The most common site for esophageal foreign body impaction is at the level of the cricopharyngeus. Understanding the anatomical constriction points of the esophagus is crucial for diagnosing and managing esophageal impactions effectively.

questions.text: A 32-year-old woman, G3P2L2, in active labor with arrested cervical dilation at 8 cm, underwent an emergency cesarean section. The newborn was healthy, but the mother developed severe postpartum hemorrhage unresponsive to conservative measures. An emergency hysterectomy was performed as a life-saving intervention. What is the legal justification for performing this procedure without explicit consent from the patient?

options.label: A
options.text: The procedure exposed the physician to legal action for battery.

options.label: B
options.text: The hysterectomy was justified under emergency doctrine, thus shielding the physician from liability.

options.label: C
options.text: Consent for the hysterectomy should have been obtained during labor.

options.label: D
options.text: Post-operative counseling of the patient and family about the procedure was unnecessary.

questions.correct_answer: B. The hysterectomy was justified under emergency doctrine, thus shielding the physician from liability.
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) The hysterectomy was justified under emergency doctrine, thus shielding the physician from liability.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In emergency situations where a delay in treatment could result in significant harm or death, such as intractable postpartum hemorrhage, the law permits life-saving interventions without prior consent under the doctrine of necessity, as stipulated in BNS Section 30 (IPC 92).

questions.text: A 34-year-old patient has been experiencing recurrent lower lip swelling for six months, presenting as a soft, translucent cystic lesion, as depicted in the provided image. What is the most appropriate diagnosis and management for this condition? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.correct_answer: B. Mucous retention cyst; Surgical excision
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Mucous retention cyst; Surgical excision

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Mucous retention cysts in the lip should be managed by surgical excision to ensure complete removal and prevent recurrence, as they result from the obstruction of minor salivary gland ducts and do not typically resolve spontaneously.
